comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I hope that something close to the current price or perhaps 10% less will be the bottom, but of course Bitcoin can go lower than that, and stay low for months. There's nothing to guarantee Bitcoin's pump by the end of the year, either. December 2021 was the time of Bitcoin falling from $56k to $46k. December 2020 was the time of rising from $19k to $28k. December 2019 was uneventful as Bitcoin kind of remained in a dip between $6k+ and below $8k. In 2018 Bitcoin fell from $4k to $3k but recovered to $4k by the end of the month. Bottom line is, Bitcoin behaves very differently in December depending on a year, so I don't see why this time we'd be graced with a jump.
